meanings.definition: Money or property left to someone in a will.
meanings.sent1: She received a large sum of money as a legacy from her grandmother.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer read out the will, revealing the various legacies left to family members.
meanings.sent3: In a surprising twist, the cat inherited a vast legacy from its eccentric owner.
meanings.sent4: The legacy of kindness he left behind continued to grow long after he was gone.
meanings.sent5: The legacy of generosity from the philanthropist touched many lives.

meanings.definition: Something handed down from an ancestor or predecessor.
meanings.sent1: The antique watch was a cherished legacy passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: Each family heirloom carried a unique legacy of history and tradition.
meanings.sent3: The magical ring was an unexpected legacy from a long-lost relative.
meanings.sent4: The legacy of storytelling in her family was as rich as it was captivating.
meanings.sent5: The legacy of hard work instilled by her parents drove her to succeed.

meanings.sent1: The legacy of his teachings continued to inspire students for years to come.
meanings.sent2: The artist's legacy of creativity and innovation shaped the art world.
meanings.sent3: The legacy of laughter he left behind brought smiles to many faces.
meanings.sent4: Her legacy of positivity was like a beacon of light in a dark world.
meanings.sent5: The legacy of his courage in the face of adversity inspired many to persevere.
